description:
Upon successful completion of the module, the student shall be able to:
1)  understand and describe the major principles and types of rheology; and
2)  how these can be applied to give the required structure, texture and viscosity in a processed biomaterials.

Major topics covered include viscosity of Newtonian and non-Newtonian fluids, viscoelastic properties of weak and strong gels, transient responses of a wide range of food and pharmaceutical products, and theoretical/empirical modelling of mechanical properties.
title: Rheology and Textural Properties of Biomaterials
